text: The Central Tongu District is one of the twenty five (25) districts in the Volta Region of Ghana. Its capital is Adidome. Central Tongu district was established in 2012 by Legislative Instrument LI. 2077, when it was carved from North Tongu District. The district is bordered to the north by Adaklu District and Agotime Ziope District, to the east by Akatsi South District, to the south by South Tongu District, and to the west by North Tongu District and Ho West District. According to the 2010 census, the population of the district is 59,411, with 27,790 males and 31,621 females. ==References== Category:Districts of Volta Region
title: Central Tongu District
